intro: Erigeron concinnus var. aphanactis, commonly known as the slender blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, and it is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and typically blue or purple in color. This variety is distinguished by its more slender growth form compared to other varieties of Erigeron concinnus.
